title: NYC Chinatown mourns 4 homeless victims as city moves to increase outreach
text:
chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-09 05:46

Residents pay tribute this week at a memorial created near where 83-year-old Chuen Kwok, a Hong Kong native, slept and was bludgeoned to death in Manhattan Chinatown early Saturday. Randy Santos, 24, himself homeless, allegedly battered five homeless men around 1:30 am Saturday with a 3-foot, 15-pound metal bar. "It's a shame that those people with the least ability to care for themselves aren't cared for by society," said Bob, who suggested governments at all levels do more.
